programme.title: Needle Park Baby
programme.desc: Based on the autobiography by Michelle Halbneer, “Needle Park Baby” recounts the unbelievable story of an eleven-year-old girl and a childhood growing up with heroin addicted parents set in Platzspitzpark, Zurich’s public drug scene in the nineties.

programme.title: The Black Minutes
programme.desc: Vicente Rangel, a musician turned detective, embarks on a police case to catch a murderer of girls in a corrupt oil town on the Gulf of Mexico.

programme.title: Midnight At The Paradise
programme.desc: Over the course of one evening, three couples are pulled into a collision course of sexual chemistry, delusion, forgiveness and hope as they explore what love, death, desire and the magic of the movies mean to them.

programme.title: Forever-Forever
programme.desc: In late 90s Kyiv, rebellious Tonia joins a gang, seeking protection and belonging. Amidst the ruins of the post-soviet city, she finds herself tangled up in a secret love triangle and confronting her abusive past.

programme.title: Confetti
programme.desc: Due to her dyslexia, Meimei is ostracized by her school and community. Encouraged by Meimei's teacher from school, Lan leaves everything behind in China for New York City in hopes of finding an education program for her daughter.

programme.title: Happier Times, Grump
programme.desc: When Grump's wife dies, he sees no reason to live on. But just as his coffin is finished, Grump gets a new spark and a major secret! His teenage granddaughter is in trouble and needs help and wisdom from her grandfather, and the warmth of his fireplace.

programme.title: Nick-Off Duty
programme.desc: When Lenny sets off on a mission to avenge her mother’s murder, she finds herself in trouble with the Russian mob and an underground organ harvesting ring. Her father, Hamburg cop Nick and his partner must race against the clock to rescue her.

programme.title: Murder At Land's End
programme.desc: A woman’s body is found washed up on a beach. Labelled as a murder case, it resembles a sinister, old Breton legend about the transportation of dead souls. Captain Meyer takes on the case but is instead intrigued by his mysterious partner, Captain Leroy.

programme.title: Needle Park Baby
programme.desc: Based on the autobiography by Michelle Halbneer, “Needle Park Baby” recounts the unbelievable story of an eleven-year-old girl and a childhood growing up with heroin addicted parents set in Platzspitzpark, Zurich’s public drug scene in the nineties.

programme.title: A Son
programme.desc: A family’s holiday in Tunisia ends in disaster, when their 10-year-old son Aziz is shot during a terrorist ambush. At the hospital where Aziz is in desperate need of a transplant, the family discovers a long-buried secret.

programme.title: Far Frontiers
programme.desc: Maria, wife of a deputy commander of a Russian military base in Kyrgyzstan, begins a relationship with another officer. Their affair quickly spirals out of control, fatally and irreversibly changing the course of Maria's and her family's life.

programme.title: Adam
programme.desc: Abla runs a modest local bakery from her home in Casablanca where she lives alone with her 8-year-old daughter, Warda. When Samia, a young pregnant woman knocks on their door, Abla is far from imagining that her life will change forever.

programme.title: Confetti

programme.desc: Looking to settle their scores once and for all, Harley and the Squad cook up a mean plan to serve up some sweet revenge!

programme.title: Happier Times, Grump
programme.desc: When Grump's wife dies, he sees no reason to live on. But just as his coffin is finished, Grump gets a new spark and a major secret! His teenage granddaughter is in trouble and needs help and wisdom from her grandfather, and the warmth of his fireplace.

programme.title: Murder At Land's End
programme.desc: A woman’s body is found washed up on a beach. Labelled as a murder case, it resembles a sinister, old Breton legend about the transportation of dead souls. Captain Meyer takes on the case but is instead intrigued by his mysterious partner, Captain Leroy.

programme.title: A Son
programme.desc: A family’s holiday in Tunisia ends in disaster, when their 10-year-old son Aziz is shot during a terrorist ambush. At the hospital where Aziz is in desperate need of a transplant, the family discovers a long-buried secret.

programme.title: Far Frontiers
programme.desc: Maria, wife of a deputy commander of a Russian military base in Kyrgyzstan, begins a relationship with another officer. Their affair quickly spirals out of control, fatally and irreversibly changing the course of Maria's and her family's life.

programme.title: Wars
programme.desc: Following in her father’s footsteps, and yearning to fill the existential emptiness within her, 20-year-old Emma decides to join the army. In an environment of harsh discipline and repressive rules, Emma unexpectedly falls in love with her superior.

programme.title: Adam
programme.desc: Abla runs a modest local bakery from her home in Casablanca where she lives alone with her 8-year-old daughter, Warda. When Samia, a young pregnant woman knocks on their door, Abla is far from imagining that her life will change forever.

programme.title: Murders In Lorraine
programme.desc: A corpse clutching a crystal chess piece is found in an old fortress. Lieutenant Muller and a young female intern work on the case. Much to his horror, the clues lead him to his family-owned crystal factory – a legacy he abandoned for his police dream.

programme.title: Thou Shalt Not Hate
programme.desc: Simone is an established surgeon and son of a holocaust survivor. After refusing to save a victim of a traffic accident with a swastika tattoo, he must grapple with the guilt he feels from his decision.

programme.title: For The Birds
programme.desc: Irma is a tomboy who believes independence is the only form of freedom. Then she meets Sampie, a charming rugby player with a heart of gold and oh-so-soft hands who sweeps her right off her feet to the altar, but not before she teaches him a thing or two.

programme.title: Sarah Kohr: The Devil's Moor
programme.desc: While driving with her mother, detective Sarah Kohr witnesses a robbery at a gas station and intervenes. After subduing the perpetrator who turns out to be just a 15-year-old, she has to investigate how he was able to get his hand on a live weapon.

programme.title: A House In Jerusalem
programme.desc: Grappling with the loss of her mother, Rebecca and her father relocate to Jerusalem for a fresh start. In the eerie Valley of the Ghosts, strange occurrences unfold, and Rebecca embarks on a journey to unravel the mysteries within the old house and city.

programme.title: Just Like A Woman
programme.desc: Two women travel from Chicago to Santa Fe to escape their suffocating lives. Marilyn dreams of winning a contest held by a famous belly dancing company, while her friend, Mona, has a darker secret.

programme.title: Difret
programme.desc: A true story. 14-year-old Hirut is on her way home when men on horses swoop in and kidnap her. She fought back but accidently killed her would-be husband. Tenacious young lawyer Meza’s decision to defend Hirut threatens not only her career but her life.

programme.title: Sarah Kohr: Ward
programme.desc: It is no coincidence that detective Sarah Kohr intervenes when the life-threatening attack on a Chinese businessman in Hamburg completely overwhelms his bodyguards. Sarah knows that her former colleague Lanz was behind it, but she needs to find out why.
